cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camaguey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest today, turning northwest after entering the Gulf of Mexico and aiming for the Texas-Louisiana Gulf Coast mid-week, then recurving northeastward inland toward the lower Mississippi Valley and Tennessee Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas/Louisiana border along the northwest Gulf Coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to the lower Florida Keys (Craig Key to Key West)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings across much of Cuba, Cayman Islands, and Dry Tortugas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northwestern Gulf Coast from Texas–Louisiana border eastward into coastal Mississippi and Alabama expected to receive core impacts
weather_observation.wind: Remnant low could bring occasional gusts 20-30 mph as it passes south of Lake Erie late week-end
weather_observation.storm_surge: None – lake levels not expected to be affected by this tropical system
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of remnant rainfall possible late Saturday into Sunday, enough for brief localized ponding but not widespread flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief reduced visibility and wet berths may slow cargo handling; otherwise minimal operational impact expected
